msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 11 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 27; Text: Q 24:34-Q 28:19 with some interruptions; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 205 x 133 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 13: "34 E. H. 27 Kur’an’dan bir parça Parşömen. 133mm boy ve 205mm eninde cönk şeklinde 11 yaprak. Sahifede II-III. (VIII-IX) asıra ait ufak kûfî ile 155mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Miklep, şemse ve köşelikli kabartma yaldız ve kırmızı renkle müzehhep koyu nefti deri cilt. Y. 1b de Nūr (24) suresinin 34. ayetinin (ولقد) انزلنا اليكم... ibaresinden başlar; Y. 4a da Furḳān (25) suresinin başından aynı surenin 10. ayetine kadar gider, arada birkaç yaprak eksiktir; aynı surenin 48. ayetinin ortasından devamla Y. 6a da Şuʿarā’ (26) suresine geçer ve 132. ayette kesilerek Neml (27) suresinin 80. ayetinin ortasından devamla Y. 10b de Ḳaṣaṣ (28) suresine geçerek bu surenin 19. ayetinin جباراً في الارض ibaresiyle biter."

This can be translated as follows: "34 E. H. 27 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 11 junk shaped leaves of 133 mm height and 205 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd(8th-9th) centuries [contains] 15 lines measuring 155 mm. Dark green leather binding illuminated with red color, a flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and golden embossing. L. 1b begins with the words (ولقد) انزلنا اليكم... of Q 24:34 (Sūra al-Nūr), L. 4a begins with Q 25 (Sūra al-Furqān) and continues until verse 10 of the same sūra, some leaves in between are missing. It continues from the middle of verse 48 of the same sūra until Q 26 (Sūra al-Shuʿarāʾ), cuts off in the verse 132 and continues with the middle part of Q 27:80 until Q 28 on L. 10b and ends there with the words جباراً في الارض of verse 19 of the same sūra."
